did.abstract: Two letters from C.M. Clark and his wife to their nephews, William and Tom. The Clarks express concern over not hearing from William, who was imprisoned on Johnson's Island in Sandusky, Ohio. Clark asks for news and whether N.C. soldiers there needed funds. He also mentions that Gov. Vance was hoping to send clothing to troops held there.
